comments.comment:
Since different materials absorb X-rays at different levels, the image on the monitor lets the machine operator see distinct items inside your bag. Items are typically colored on the display monitor, based on the range of energy that passes through the object, to represent one of three main categories:

Organic
Inorganic
Metal

replies.replyComment: suresh wignarajah I‚Äôm telling what New Zealand and Australia does. There is a trained dog to identify fruits, water bottles and vegetables at the airport. That called bio security.

Uddika Dissanayake spot on and Since different materials absorb X-rays at different levels, the image on the monitor lets the machine operator see distinct items inside your bag. Items are typically colored on the display monitor, based on the range of energy that passes through the object, to represent one of three main categories:

Organic
Inorganic
Metal
While the colors used to signify "inorganic" and "metal" may vary between manufacturers, all X-ray systems use shades of orange to represent "organic." This is because most explosives are organic.

replies.replyComment:
@PJay Travel - mate some people here can't get your point. In vain you are trying to educate them on this subject. No wonder people like this get elected as politicians in Sri Lanka üòÇ
 Cheers mate.
PJay Travel Memories mokakda bn chathura me gobbaya kiyanne. Yako meke eun baninne e gani kata karana widiha waradi kiyala. Me yakata pissu e ganita denna yanawa

@Chathura I   Please refer to following website  http://www.agriculture.gov.au/biosecurity/australia/detector-dogs
 by Australian Dept of Agriculture and Water Resources, and read the following  defenition.
Detector Dogs -
‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãDepartment of Agriculture and Water Resources detector dogs play a vital role in helping to protect Australia from exotic pests and diseases and are used in conjunction with a number of other biosecurity strategies and detection technologies. The department‚Äôs detector dog teams are deployed at international passenger terminals, mail facilities and courier depots throughout Australia.

Mate Melbourne is not an excemption, and particularly Melbourne Airport is the tuffest on bio security out of all Australian States.
If you have not seen them before, watch for them next time.  Usually, they sniff the checked in arrival bags before loaded on to the passanger belt (behind scenes).   Once they detect any suspicious item, they mark the bags with chalk (usually a cross) and wait until the person picks it up at the belt and take it to the customs queue.  Without your knowledge your have been screened even before you take your baggage to the customs counter and the people there challanges you once they see the markings on your baggage.  Perhaps you now know how it happens.  They only bring the dogs to the public area when they have people comming from certain suspect countries that they suspect people bring items in their carry baggages. Then the passangers are asked to lay down all their bags including their carry bags on the floor and get the dogs sniff the bags.  Therefore please be safe next time you travel, as people in Australian customs are smarter than you think.  I thank you for engaging in a dialouge with civilized words unlike most of our own countrymen who talk in this forum.  It is best to engage objectively without personal attacks, so that we can share our views and knowledge.

PJay Travel Memories ane hutto ube sanwara kama. He ugathek kiyala hitan inne uba ne. Ane pako uba uda eunta English walin bannata yako uba hitan inne hena dial eka kiyala. Un ekek war habai unge ugathkam pennanna gihin na. English gahala porak kiyala hitan inne. Hena ginek bn uba. Lankawe inna sinhala mahacharya waru modayo mu kiyana widihata

PJay Travel Memories That‚Äôs what i am saying man there is no any bio security sniffer dogs in Melbourne airport. You didn‚Äôt provide any factual. As you said we didn‚Äôt go any where in world you think you are the only intelligent man , you are the man who only travel from sri lanka to australia. Many of sri lankan can go every where in world. You think that only you can. Shame yourself as you may have mental problem as you think that you only educated you only travelled to Australia hahah üòÇ sad ü§£ ü§£

@Chathura I Be factual to win your arguments mate, Not personal Attacks!  Do not go out of the tropic, but focus on the tropic here, which is "Does Bio Security Sniffer Dogs exist or not",  if I have proved they do exist, you need to eat your humble pie!  If you can prove that they don't exist I will do the same.  Fair call for both of us?  Personal attack or distructive critisism is not the right way to end an interesting dialouge.  The same way we started lets us end it  in a friendly way.  That is the way the people who have set foot into Australia behave.  Or you have a choice to remain silent and not to respond at all.

I never came Australia you only person came to Australia. Do you think using englis is a big thing for you. Same scenario where we can see in this video. This lady might be in your team as she also think using english in a sinhala media conference is big thing and she can show her education. But education is not only depends on english. You think you are very educated person as using english. what a madness man you think. it doesn't matter to using wrong english but you should shy if you cant using your own language.

@Chathura IMy so called Australian collegue, I am expecting an answer from you whether you are convinced or not about the use of  the 'Bio Diversity Dogs' in Australia.  I hope you are educated enough to understand the contents of the video clip and the website I sent to you. If you do not understand English, it is high time you do some English course in Australia and I can arrange that for you, only if you are nice in the future with your attitude.  I have proved you with facts about what I mention in this conversation.  Do you have any factual evidance to support your arguments. Otherwise,in this case  a person who truly lives in Australia would show his gentlemanship by apologizing for showing his ignorance.  However, the way you conducted yourself in this conversation,  I believe that you have no idea where Australia is located in the world map, and you have never set your foot outside of Sri Lanka.  Love to hear from you mate!

@PJay Travel Memories What you say is 100% true.  An elderly couple from India who were in front of me got detained after a sniffer dog ( I think it was a Labrador) making a detection.  Since I was just behind them I asked what did they have and they said it was "pickle". This was at the Melbourne Tullamarine Airport.

@Chathura I It is good to talk to fellow countryman, who claims to be living in Australia.  God Day Mate!
Without getting involved into a hot debate, could you please click the following link and watch the video clip and then understand yourself the law of the country you claim to be living.  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9_VmfQ6mX38&feature=youtu.be
I also include you the following link, so that you will be better educated when you transit through customs and immigration next time, so that you will not go to jail or cop a heavy fine for bringing in illigal items into the country.
http://www.agriculture.gov.au/travelling/arriving-in-australia 
Now that you are living in Australia, it is best to converse more civilized mate.   Here we both are living in a civilized society.  I would love to hear from you in English, because both you and I are living in a country where people deal with eachother in English!  Cheers mate -  PJay

PJay Travel Memories mama Australia wala tamai inne. Oya loku traveler kenek kiywane ehenm oya okkoma dannawa aty. Mamanm dakalana ballo dala Melbourne airport eke check karanawa. Palaturu kiyak un hoyagannada ehema baluwama. Un iwa karanne drugs etakota meat jathi walatat awit iwa karanawa. Me moda ganiyek wage uttara denna dennet natiwa prashna ahagena ahagena tana widihata melo minihekta kata karatahakida. Ahanna ona prashna hari kenagen ahannona. Wash policy makers la misak ballo gana wath airpoy immigration wala specialised kenek newe. Wenna ona de kiuwama karana widiha specialised aya karanne.
PJay Travel Memories ane uba Australia awith tiyenawada danna magula
